image.altText: Headshot of a tiger

props.synopsis: Perth Zoo's beloved Sumatran tiger Jaya dies, seven years after being diagnosed with cancer and nine years after his mother also died of the disease.

title.children: Keepers 'heartbroken' after Perth Zoo's last tiger Jaya dies

image.altText: Image of soldier in historic uniform with words from letter in background

props.synopsis: A century-old message in a bottle from a World War I soldier to his mother has been found on a beach in Western Australia's south.

title.children: WWI soldier's message in a bottle found on WA beach

image.altText: an old green building

props.synopsis: The Gnowangerup Hotel in WA's southern grain belt is changing hands after the building and business were purchased by the community through a cooperative.Â

title.children: The WA towns where you can buy shares in the local pub

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump hold up signed documents in front of flags

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump were all smiles as they inked a $3 billion critical minerals deal touted as a good deal for all. But has Australia drawn the short end of the stick?

title.children: The good, the bad and the ugly of our critical minerals deal with Trump

image.altText: Camels on a beach.

props.synopsis: The tourism industry in WA's far north says international and domestic flight cuts have limited access to the region and cost it more than 1,400 international visitors.

title.children: Broome tourism takes estimated $4m hit as flights axed

image.altText: Woman on stage with green and blue lighting.

props.synopsis: Perth Festival unveils a diverse program making use of unconventional event spaces, but large-scale opening and closing events are markedly missing this year.Â

title.children: Social media performance and secret locations in Perth Festival line-up

image.altText: Clinton Walker stands on a large rock in the middle of Murujuga National Park. He looks to the sky while the sun sets behind him

props.synopsis: There are more than 2 million artworks on the rocks at Murujuga, with more stories under the waves.

title.children: Ancient rock art in northern WA shows Tasmanian tiger, Tasmanian devil

image.altText: A man in a black suit and red tie wheels a body on a stretcher to a van during a car crash simulation.

props.synopsis: A simulated road crash and an introduction to the local undertaker are part of a confronting, but what police say is effective, road safety program in WA's south.Â

title.children: Teens shown the confronting reality of road trauma

image.altText: A picture of the outside of a business in an industrial area

props.synopsis: A sandblasting and spray-painting business is fined more than $1 million over the death of a teenager who was critically injured at a Perth factory.

title.children: Company slapped with $1 million penalty after 16yoâs workplace death

image.altText: A dolphin in the ocean with a brown sea sponge on it.

props.synopsis: Scientists observe male humpback dolphins parading sea sponges on their heads to impress females off Western Australia's northern coast.

title.children: Male dolphins spotted donning sea-sponge wigs to attract females

image.altText: A mine site on a small island with ocean and a boat

props.synopsis: A rockfall prompts Mount Gibson Iron to wind down operations at its Koolan Island mine in WA's far north earlier than expected, with 450 workers made redundant.

title.children: More than 400 jobs axed as rockfall leads to mine's closure off WA coast

image.altText: A video of an alleged stolen vehicle chasing a police car.

props.synopsis: Children as young as 10 have been arrested as stolen vehicles are driven recklessly at police cars.

title.children: Kimberley police warn juvenile crime 'won't be tolerated'

image.altText: a dirty kitchen grate

props.synopsis: Steve Pates has worked in kitchens all around Australia, but says what he witnessed at a business in WA's far north was beyond anything he had ever seen.

title.children: Jon Bon Jovi compares vocal cord surgery rehab to footy injury recovery

image.altText: Two hands with white gloves handle gold bullion

props.synopsis: A major investment bank says gold is following share markets higher. While the precious metal consistently pushes record highs, it suggests the gold price could continue to rise substantially. But what's really at stake?

title.children: 'Bubbles will burst' and $4 trillion of Australian super is at risk

image.altText: Three women sit under a shady tree on a limestone wall. From left to right wearing a dress, collard shirt, tshirt with hat.

props.synopsis: Jessie Carrie could not find the support she needed after being diagnosed with ADHD as an adult, so she started groups to help others. Â

title.children: Support groups helping connect women diagnosed with ADHD later in life

image.altText: 4WD behind a police vehicle with flashing light.

props.synopsis: A video of an erratically driven vehicle chasing a police car in Kununurra on Wednesday has been posted on social media.

title.children: Pursuit aborted after juveniles allegedly chase police in stolen cars

image.altText: A close-up view of a phone charging on a power bank

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia is reviewing its rules on portable power banks following a mid-air fire on one of its planes.

title.children: Virgin Australia reviewing power bank rules after fire on board

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands.

props.synopsis: A top Moscow official says he believes the US, Ukraine and Russia are close to a "diplomatic solution" on the conflict.

title.children: Russian envoy says Trump, Putin meeting will likely happen 'at a later date'

image.altText: A dark-haired woman in a dark blazer stands in front of a large crowd on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Speaking to supporters outside the court following brief arraignment, Letitia James said the Trump administration is using the justice system as a "vehicle of retribution".

image.altText: Prince Andrew looks over his shoulder while King Charles looks at him

props.synopsis: In a week where King Charles said he hoped to project unity as a "bulwark against those promoting conflict, division and tyranny", his scandal-ridden brother reigned supreme.

title.children: Charles is reluctant to evict his 'Prince Andrew problem', but William would

image.altText: A school bus on fire on the side of a country road.

props.synopsis: Firefighters race to extinguish a school bus that burst into flames before this morning's school run in WA's South West, with the driver unharmed and no children on board.

title.children: Driver has lucky escape as school bus bursts into flames

image.altText: Brodie Kostecki of Dick Johnson Racing watching a monitor

props.synopsis: Four photographers had to be rushed to hospital after suffering injuries when Brodie Kostecki crashed his car into a wall during the Supercars' Gold Coast round.

title.children: Photographers taken to hospital after Supercars crash

image.altText: Phil Gore smiles above a caption which reads "PHIL GORE WINNER - 114 LAPS"

image.altText: A small, brown , furry northern quoll up close.

props.synopsis: Rat bait poison has been found in threatened northern quoll populations as an overdue report into their use by the federal pesticides regulator is again delayed.

title.children: Threatened native animals at risk as rat bait review delayed again

image.altText: Jason Sourasis and Scott Pendlebury.

props.synopsis: Former Magpies skipper Scott Pendlebury has hired one of Australia's most high-profile commercial lawyers to claim millions that he alleges his former confidant misappropriated.

image.altText: A smiling Sam Kerr pumps her fists in celebration after scoring a goal for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr is back with the Matildas and ready to start taking big steps towards a dream of lifting silverware with the current group of players.

title.children: 'Would be a dream come true': Sam Kerr's big Asian Cup ambition

image.altText: Lib dog

props.synopsis: The Liberals have faced an existential crisis over climate and energy twice in recent memory. The damage must live in the memory of today's parliamentarians, who face the prospect of another episode.

title.children: Tough lesson for Libs in proverb about dogs and vomit, fools and folly

image.altText: A woman wearing fascinator with purple flowers and jacket, adorned with pearls.

props.synopsis: Sirikit, who succumbed to a blood infection, is remembered as a champion of the poor.

title.children: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit dies aged 93

image.altText: Chloe Saliaris stands in the snow

props.synopsis: Australia excels in the gravity-defying winter sports discipline of aerial skiing, despite not having a single snow facility in the entire country. Â

title.children: 'Aussie grit' key to aerial skiing heights ahead of Winter Olympics

image.altText: Four ambulances parked at a hospital.

props.synopsis: A paramedic has been sentenced for stealing vials of an opioid used for pain relief, refilling them with saline and returning them into circulation in WA ambulances.

title.children: Ambulance station manager steals fentanyl, refills vials with saline

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The unintended consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs may be the exact opposite of what was intended: closer links between ASEAN countries and China, and the creation of an even bigger manufacturing hub in south-east Asia.

title.children: Unintended consequences of Trump's tariffs on display at Asian summit

image.altText: Eight book covers pictured on a blue background

props.synopsis: Wondering what to read? This month's best books include the latest from Jane Harper, Bri Lee and Booker Prize winner Kiran Desai.

title.children: The eight books our critics couldn't put down in October
